name: u2i
tagline: u2i - Arduino-based USB/serial <-> I2C, SMBus Bridge
body:
### Welcome to u2i
Arduino-based USB/serial to I2C/SMBus bridge. Bridges between USB/(virtual)serial and I2C/SMBus using a very simple command set. Host-side, please use a suitable terminal (e.g. [Gtkterm](https://fedorahosted.org/gtkterm/)). The commands are simple enough to be manually typed. Supported SMBus transactions are Read Byte/Word, Write Byte/Word. For writing, command grouping is fully supported. I2C transmission rates of 100kb/s and 400kb/s have been tested (other transmission speeds may also work).

### New Features
**v0.5** 30/12/2013 Write command grouping  
**v0.4** 29/12/2013 Status byte added (command z)

### Commands
* `a [a..]` _view/set i2c address(es)_
* `f [speed]` _view/set bus frequency in kHz (kb/s)_
* `h` _show help_
* `r [c] [b]` _smbus read byte/word c=command b=nof_bytes_
* `s [a0] [a1]` _scan i2c bus from address a0 to a1_
* `v` _show version_
* `w [c] [b..]` _smbus write byte(s) c=command_
* `z [v]` _view/set status byte_

***
_Notes:_

1. all values to u2i in hex w/o format specified
1. smbus write commands will be grouped and sent to all set addresses
1. smbus read commands issued to first set address (only)

***


### Supported Arduino platforms
1. [Arduino Micro](http://arduino.cc/en/Main/arduinoBoardMicro)
1. [Arduino Leonardo](http://arduino.cc/en/Main/ArduinoBoardLeonardo)  


```
t.b.d.
```

### Support
Please contact KR (@kr64) if any problems are experienced. I'll do my best to fix.
